1.speaker: PANDA MAMA
1.english: If I don't hurry, I'm going to be late! Don't suck me up!

4.speaker: PANDA MAMA
4.english: Sorry. I have to leave soon, so I'm in a hurry.

5.speaker: PANDA MAMA
5.japanese: そうだわ！お詫びといっちゃあなんだけど…
5.english: I know. As an apology... So, she gave you these?

6.speaker: PANDA
6.japanese: まったくお母さんには困っちゃうよ
6.english: Seriously, I don't know what I'm going to do with my mom.

7.speaker: PANDA
7.japanese: 掃除機なんて世界からなくなっちゃえばいいのに
7.english: Vacuums should just disappear from the world.

8.speaker: PENGUIN
8.japanese: なくさなくて　いいんじゃないかな？
8.english: I don't think they need to disappear.

9.speaker: PENGUIN
9.japanese: キミのとこは　珍しい掃除機の使い方だから
9.english: The way vacuums are used at your house is rather unique.

10.speaker: PENGUIN
10.english: Thank you for the food. Hey, this is good. Are those sweets from Toraya, Panda?

11.speaker: PANDA
11.japanese: さぁ…　お母さんに聞いてよ
11.english: I don't know. Ask my mom.

12.speaker: PENGUIN
12.japanese: 魚が好きな僕には　最高のフォルムだし　味もいいよ！
12.english: It's the perfect form for a fish-lover like me and it tastes great, too.

13.speaker: PENGUIN
13.japanese: トラヤのお菓子は最高だね！
13.english: Sweets from Toraya are great. Oh.

14.speaker: POLAR BEAR
14.japanese: ペンギンさん　うちのお菓子もどう？
14.english: Mr. Penguin. Would you like to try our sweets, too?

15.speaker: PENGUIN
15.japanese: あるの？　じゃあ…　いただこうかな！
15.english: You have some? Sure, I'll have some.

16.speaker: POLAR BEAR
16.japanese: どうぞ…　シーラカンスだよ
16.english: Here you go. It's a coelacanth.

18.speaker: PENGUIN
18.japanese: 生きた化石はお菓子の題材として　どうなんだろうね
18.english: but I'm not sure about sweetsshaped like a living fossil.

21.speaker: TIGER
21.japanese: なにぃ～？　今日で辞めさせてくれだと～？
21.english: What?! You're quitting as of today? Damn, that Zebra...

22.speaker: TIGER
22.japanese: やっぱり草食系は根性ねえなぁ

25.speaker: TIGER
25.japanese: こんな昼間にどうした
25.english: What brings you here so early?

26.speaker: TIGER
26.english: Are you off today? Yeah, actually...

27.speaker: WOLF
27.japanese: 先月でパン屋辞めちゃったんだ
27.english: I quit the bakery last month. Why?!

28.speaker: WOLF
28.japanese: 勤務時間が長過ぎて　腰痛めちゃって…
28.english: The work hours were too long and I hurt my back.

29.speaker: TIGER
29.japanese: おいおい…　大丈夫かよ

30.speaker: WOLF
30.japanese: なにより…　やっぱりパン屋は　むいてないっぽい
30.english: It would seem that I'm not fit to work at a bakery.

31.speaker: TIGER
31.japanese: って！　ま～た自信喪失か？
31.english: What? You're beating yourself up again?

32.speaker: TIGER
32.japanese: お前なぁ…　ヘタれてる暇ないって
32.english: You don't have time to sit around being depressed.

33.speaker: TIGER
33.japanese: 肉食系なんだから　ガツガツ次行けって！
33.english: You're a carnivore! Show some guts and go at it!

34.speaker: WOLF
34.japanese: 僕はトラくんみたいに　強くないんだよ！　ボディもメンタルも！
34.english: But I'm not as strong as you are, Tiger! Neither physically or mentally!

35.speaker: TIGER
35.japanese: 猛獣のくせに　僕とか言ってんじゃね～よ！！
35.english: You're a fierce beast! Don't talk so meekly!

37.japanese: ただの大きい犬だよ　僕なんて…
37.english: I'm nothing but an overgrown mutt.

38.speaker: TIGER
38.japanese: おい…　お前も立派な猛獣だって
38.english: Hey... You're a fierce beast, too...

39.speaker: WOLF
39.japanese: 僕…　もうパン屋は諦めて　自転車で日本一周するよ
39.english: I'm... ...going to forget about the bakery and just ride across Japan on a bicycle.

40.speaker: TIGER
40.japanese: おい…　日本一周したからって　自分は見つからないぜ
40.english: Hey... simply riding across Japan doesn't mean you'll find yourself.

41.speaker: WOLF
41.japanese: じゃあ…　ポエムでも書いて　駅前で売るよ…
41.english: Then... I'll write poems and sell them in front of the station.

42.speaker: WOLF
42.japanese: 確かにオオカミだけどよ…
42.english: Well, yeah, you are a wolf, but... Oh, I know...

43.speaker: TIGER
43.japanese: なぁ　よかったら　この店手伝ってくれねえか？
43.english: How about you help me with the shop?

45.speaker: TIGER
45.japanese: バイトが１人辞めちまって　困ってんだ
45.english: One of my part-timers just quit, so I'm in a bind.

47.speaker: WOLF
47.english: S-Sure. So you're having some more today, Mr. Penguin? I'm in the mood for Japanese sweets instead of raw fish today.

48.speaker: POLAR BEAR
48.english: Mr. Penguin. I have a bad feeling about this... You made something, didn't you?

49.speaker: POLAR BEAR
49.english: Was it obvious? All right. I'll give it a gander.

50.speaker: POLAR BEAR
50.japanese: こちらになります　らんちゅう
50.english: This would be it. It's a ranchu.

53.speaker: PANDA MAMA
53.japanese: あら　オオカミさんじゃないの
53.english: Oh, well if it isn't Mr. Wolf.

54.speaker: PANDA MAMA
54.japanese: あなた　前に　サルさんのパン屋さんにいなかった？
54.english: Didn't you used to work at Monkey's Bakery?

55.speaker: WOLF
55.japanese: あそこは辞めたんです　腰痛めちゃって…
55.english: Actually, don't work there anymore. I hurt my back.

56.speaker: PANDA MAMA
56.english: Oh my. Are you all right?

58.speaker: WOLF
58.japanese: 次が決まるまで　ここで　バイトさせてもらってます
58.english: I'm working here part-time until I find another job.

59.speaker: PANDA MAMA
59.japanese: まぁ…　早く治るといいわね
59.english: Oh my. I hope you feel better soon.

60.speaker: WOLF
60.japanese: はい　ありがとうございます

61.speaker: WOLF
61.japanese: で　今日は何になさいますか？
61.english: So, what would you like today? Oh.

62.speaker: PANDA MAMA
62.japanese: あ　このヤマアラシまん　５個くださる？
62.english: I'd like five of these porcupine buns.

64.speaker: PANDA MAMA
64.japanese: 今日は　ヤマアラシファンの　お友達のお家に行くのよ
64.english: I'm going to visit a friend today, and she's a Yama Arashi fan.

65.speaker: WOLF
65.japanese: へぇ　そうなんですか

67.speaker: PANDA MAMA
67.english: Oh, but maybe it's imprudent to eat porcupines... {\a6}We're unstoppable!

68.speaker: PANDA MAMA
68.japanese: 食べないほうがいいのかしら

69.speaker: YAMA ARASHI
69.japanese: 食べないほうがいいのかしら

70.japanese: 食べちゃっていいのかしら…
70.english: Maybe it's okay to eat them?

71.speaker: WOLF
71.japanese: 食べちゃって　いいんじゃないすかね
71.english: I think eating them would be fine.

72.speaker: WOlF
72.japanese: ありがとうございました

73.speaker: TIGER
73.japanese: そろそろ　休憩してくれよ
73.english: Hey, you can take a break.

74.speaker: WOLf
74.english: Oh, thanks. Tiger, please help yourself to these.

75.speaker: WOLF
75.japanese: 店のあんこ　もらったから　あんぱん焼いてきたんだ
75.english: You gave me some of the shop's red bean paste so I made some buns with them.

77.speaker: TIGER
77.japanese: う　うまい！　パンが香ばしいぜ！
77.english: They're... delicious! The bread is so fragrant!

78.speaker: WOLF
78.japanese: 生地に　ふすまを混ぜてるんだよ
78.english: I added wheat bran into the dough.

80.speaker: WOLF
80.japanese: 小麦の皮と　胚芽の部分だよ
80.english: It's the skin and germ of the wheat.

81.speaker: WOLF
81.japanese: 全粒粉とか使うより　香ばしくなるんだ
81.english: It becomes more fragrant than using whole wheat flour.

82.speaker: TIGER
82.japanese: うちのあんと　よく合ってる…
82.english: It goes really well with our red bean paste.

83.speaker: SASAKO
83.japanese: ここのところ　毎日それ食べてますね
83.english: You've been eating those every day lately. Mr. Penguin.

84.speaker: PENGUIN
84.japanese: もう　何も出さなくていいよ
84.english: You don't have to bring out anything else.

86.speaker: PANDA MAMA
86.japanese: ねえねえ　こないだ　遊びに行ったお友達ね
86.english: So that friend I mentioned visiting the other day...

87.speaker: PANDA MAMA
87.japanese: ご主人がパン屋さんだったのよ

88.speaker: PANDA MAMA
88.japanese: ロバのパン屋さんって　ご存じ
88.english: Do you know of Donkey's Bakery?

90.speaker: WOLF
90.japanese: あそこのパンは　すごくおいしくて　尊敬してます
90.english: Their bread is incredibly delicious.I really admire them.

91.speaker: PANDA MAMA
91.english: They were looking for a new hire. Wha?! No, no. I couldn't.

92.speaker: WOLF
92.japanese: まだまだ修業しないと！
92.english: I still have much to learn.

93.speaker: TIGER
93.english: Sounds like a great opportunity to me.

95.speaker: TIGER
95.japanese: こいつは　こう見えて

96.speaker: TIGER
96.japanese: なかなか　センスがあるんですよ
96.english: he really knows what he's doing.

98.speaker: TIGER
98.japanese: あんぱん食べたら　わかったよ
98.english: I knew as soon as I ate your buns.

99.speaker: PANDA MAMA
99.japanese: トラさんが認めるなら　たしかよね
99.english: If Mr. Tiger says so, there's no doubt about it.

100.speaker: WOLF
100.japanese: いや　待ってください

101.speaker: WOLF
101.japanese: 僕なんて　ロバさんのところで　働くには　まだまだ…
101.english: I'm definitely not skilled enough to work at Mr. Donkey's...

102.speaker: PANDA MAMA
102.english: I don't think they were in any hurry.

103.speaker: PANDA MAMA
103.japanese: とりあえず　伝えておくわね
103.english: I just wanted to tell you just in case.

104.speaker: BOTH
104.japanese: あ…　ありがとうございました

107.speaker: TIGER
107.japanese: パン屋修業が終わったら　自分の店　出すんだよな？
107.english: Once you're done training at a bakery, you were going to open your own place, right?

108.speaker: WOLF
108.japanese: そうできたらいいなって　思ってるだけだよ
108.english: I was just thinking...it'd be nice if I could do that.

109.speaker: TIGER
109.japanese: そんときは　あんぱんに　うちのあんこ　わけてやるよ
109.english: When that happens, You can use our red beanpaste in your buns.

111.speaker: WOLF
111.japanese: だって…　トラヤのあんこって

112.speaker: WOLF
112.japanese: あのロバのパン屋さんがあれほど欲しがったのに　あげなかったんでしょ？
112.english: Mr. Donkey wanted desperately to use it at his bakery, but you refused, didn't you?

113.speaker: TIGER
113.japanese: バカ野郎　お前だから　わけてやんだよ
113.english: You idiot. I'd give you some because it's you.

114.speaker: TIGER
114.japanese: ライオンも　お前が店出すときは
114.english: Even Lion said that when you open your own shop,

115.speaker: TIGER
115.japanese: 出資するって　楽しみにしてんだぜ
115.english: he'd invest in it and was looking forward to it.

117.speaker: TIGER
117.japanese: グリズリーさんだって　そうだ

118.speaker: GRIZZLY
118.japanese: あいつのパンなら　喜んで店のパンに使ってやるぜ
118.english: I'd be more than happy to have his baked goods at my bar.

119.speaker: TIGER
119.japanese: みんな　お前が一人前になるのを　待ってるんだぜ
119.english: Everyone is waiting for you to come into your own.

121.speaker: WOLF
121.japanese: みんな　猛獣のくせに　なんて　あったかいんだ！
121.english: All of you are supposed to be fierce beasts, but you're so kind.

122.speaker: WOLF
122.japanese: 俺　みんなのために頑張るよ！
122.english: I'll do my best for everyone's sake!

127.speaker: WOLF
127.japanese: パンダママさんの紹介で来ました　オオカミです
127.english: My name is Wolf and I came here on Panda Mama's referral.

130.speaker: WOLF
130.japanese: はい　こちらになります
130.english: Yes. I have it right here.

131.speaker: WOLF
131.japanese: よろしくお願いします
131.english: Thank you for your consideration. What's the matter, Tiger? You seem preoccupied. I keep thinking that you'll hear back about your interview today,

132.speaker: TIGER
132.japanese: 気が気じゃねえんだよ

134.speaker: WOLF
134.japanese: 受かっても落ちても　僕
134.english: Pass or fail, I've decided to

135.japanese: もう　パン一筋でいくよ
135.english: become a baker, no matter what.

138.speaker: WOLF
138.japanese: はい…　オオカミです

139.speaker: WOLF
139.japanese: はい…　あ…　そうですか

140.speaker: WOLF
140.japanese: はい　わかりました

143.speaker: WOLF
143.japanese: 受かった！受かったよ　トラくん！
143.english: I got it! I got it, Tiger!

144.speaker: TIGER
144.japanese: やったじゃねえか　この野郎！

145.speaker: TIGER
145.japanese: よし！　今夜は　グリズリーバー　行くぞ！
145.english: All right! We're going to the Grizzly Bar tonight! Great job, Wolf, you rascal! I see.

146.speaker: GRIZZLY
146.japanese: 今夜は　ぶっ倒れるまで飲んでけ！
146.english: Drink until you pass out tonight.

148.speaker: TIGER
148.japanese: やったぜ！　じゃあ　俺　マティーニ！
148.english: All right! I'll take a martini.

151.speaker: GRIZZLY
151.japanese: 誰が　てめえに　おごるって言ったよ！！
151.english: Who the hell said it'd be on the house for you?! Mr. Penguin hasn't been by much lately.

152.speaker: POLAR BEAR
152.english: Now that you mention it... I thought it was rather quiet. I guess it's because Mr. Penguin's not here.

153.speaker: SASAKO
153.japanese: 何か忙しいんですかね？
153.english: I wonder if he's been busy.

154.speaker: POlAR BEAR
154.english: Who knows? Maybe he took a vacation?

160.speaker: LLAMA
160.japanese: あれ？　ペンギンさん？

162.speaker: LLAMA
162.japanese: どうしたんですか？こんな所で

165.japanese: 隣町にある　ヒグマさんが　マスターのカフェです
165.english: It's a café in the next town run by Mr. Brown Bear.

166.speaker: POLAR BEAR
166.japanese: ヒグマが　ヒグマカフェ？
166.english: Brown Bear runs Brown Bear's Café? Not very original, is it?

167.speaker: LLAMA
167.japanese: しろくまカフェも　そのまんまですよね
167.english: The same could be said about Polar Bear's Café.

168.speaker: LLAMA
168.japanese: ペンギンさん　毎日　行ってるって　言ってましたよ
168.english: Mr. Penguin was saying he's been going every day.

169.speaker: PANDA
169.japanese: 毎日？　ペンギンさん　シロクマカフェに　飽きちゃったのかな？
169.english: Every day? I wonder if Mr. Penguin got tired of Polar Bear's Café.

170.speaker: LLAMA
170.japanese: ず～っと　いましたからね

171.speaker: SASAKO
171.japanese: ず～っと　いましたよね

172.speaker: PENGUIN
172.japanese: 聞いてよ　笹子さん

173.speaker: PENGUIN
173.japanese: 僕　お店で食べきれなくて　残しちゃったときに
173.english: I figured out a non-embarrassing way to take home leftovers

174.speaker: PENGUIN
174.japanese: 恥ずかしくなく持って帰る方法　考えついたんだけどさ

175.speaker: PANDA
175.japanese: ずっと　しゃべってたよね
175.english: He was always talking, wasn't he?

176.speaker: SASAKO
176.japanese: ず～っと　しゃべってましたね

177.speaker: PENGUIN
177.japanese: カフェモカ　おかわり
177.english: Could I get another café mocha?

178.speaker: PENGUIN
178.japanese: 僕は　しろくまカフェの　カフェモカがあれば
178.english: As long as I have a café mocha from Polar Bear's Café, I don't need anything else.

179.speaker: PENGUIN
179.english: But I do need fish, though.

180.speaker: SASAKO
180.japanese: いるんじゃないですか…

181.speaker: SASAKO
181.japanese: ず～っと　カフェモカ飲んでましたね
181.english: He was always drinking café mocha, wasn't he?

182.speaker: LLAMA
182.japanese: カフェモカに　飽きちゃったんですかね？
182.english: Maybe he got tired of café mochas?

183.speaker: PANDA
183.japanese: もしかして　ヒグマカフェのカフェモカしろくまカフェより　おいしいのかな？
183.english: Maybe Brown Bear's Café's café mocha tastes better than Polar Bear's Café's? Mr. Penguin is allowed to be at any café he wants to be at.

184.speaker: SASAKO
184.japanese: それはそうですけど　寂しいじゃないですか
184.english: That's true, but... It's a little lonely, don't you think?

187.speaker: SASAKO
187.japanese: シロクマさん　寂しくないんですか
187.english: Aren't you the least bit lonely, Mr. Polar Bear?

190.speaker: POLAR BEAR
190.japanese: すいません　カフェモカください
190.english: Pardon me. Could I get a café mocha, please?

192.speaker: POLAR BEAR
192.japanese: あれ？　チョコレートシロップが　少し多すぎるな
192.english: Oh? There's a bit too much chocolate syrup.

195.speaker: BROWN BEAR
195.english: Please have a seat wherever you'd like.

202.speaker: PENGUIN
202.japanese: お店行かなくてごめんね
202.english: sorry I haven't been by the café lately.

203.speaker: POLAR BEAR
203.japanese: どこのカフェに行ったって　ペンギンさんの自由だよ
203.english: You're allowed to go to any café you want, Mr. Penguin.

204.speaker: PENGUIN
204.japanese: もしかして　怒ってる？

206.speaker: PENGUIN
206.japanese: そう　ならいいけど

207.speaker: POLAR BEAR
207.japanese: このお店のカフェモカが好きなの？
207.english: Do you like this café's café mocha?

208.speaker: PENGUIN
208.japanese: ここのは甘みが強すぎて　あんまり好きじゃないんだ
208.english: They make it too sweet here,and I don't really like it.

212.speaker: WAITRESS
212.japanese: ご注文は　お決まりですか？
212.english: Are you ready to order? W-Well... Um!

215.speaker: PENGUIN
215.japanese: カ　カフェモカくれる？
215.english: C-Could I get a café mocha?

216.speaker: WAITRESS
216.japanese: はい　カフェモカですね

217.speaker: WAITRESS
217.japanese: 少々　お待ちください

218.speaker: POLAR BEAR
218.english: So that's it. Yeah. That's how it is.

219.speaker: PENGUIN
219.japanese: だから　シロクマくん

220.speaker: PENGUIN
220.japanese: お店行けなくてごめん
220.english: I'm sorry I haven't been to the Café.

223.speaker: POLAR BEAR
223.japanese: お店にこなくても　友達でしょ？
223.english: We're friends, even if you don't come by the Café, right?

225.speaker: POLAR BEAR
225.japanese: 応援するよ　ペンギンさん
225.english: I'll be rooting for you, Mr. Penguin.

226.speaker: PENGUIN
226.japanese: ありがとう　シロクマくん

227.speaker: PENGUIN
227.japanese: 僕　あの子に告白するまで　ヒグマカフェに通うよ
227.english: I'll keep stopping by Brown Bear's Café until I can ask her out!

228.speaker: POLAR BEAR
228.english: Okay, got it. I'm gonna do my best.

229.speaker: PENGUIN
229.japanese: 早く　シロクマくんのカフェモカ　飲みたいからさ
229.english: I want to hurry and drink one of your café mochas.

230.speaker: PENGUIN
230.japanese: パンダくんたちにも　よろしく言っといて
230.english: Tell Panda and the others I said "hi," as well.

232.speaker: PANDA
232.japanese: 仕事で　ゴロゴロするのも大変だよ
232.english: It's so hard to laze around at work.

233.speaker: PANDA
233.japanese: 今からは　プライベートでゴロゴロしよっと
233.english: I'm going to go laze around at home now.

234.speaker: SASAKO
234.japanese: ゴロゴロにも　いろいろ　あるんだね
234.english: So there's more than one kind of lazing around...

235.speaker: PANDA
235.japanese: あれ？　今日も　ペンギンさん来なかったの？
235.english: Oh, Mr. Penguin didn't come today, either?

237.speaker: SASAKO
237.japanese: 本当に　どうしちゃったんだろう…

240.speaker: WAITRESS
240.english: Hello. Oh, would you like your usual? Y-Yes, please!

241.speaker: SASAKO
241.japanese: えっ？　また　ペンギンさん　好きな人が　できたんですか？
241.english: What? Mr. Penguin has a new crush?

242.speaker: POLAR BEAR
242.japanese: 告白するまで　うちには来られないから
242.english: He said he wouldn't be able to come here until he asks her out,

243.speaker: POLAR BEAR
243.japanese: みんなに　よろしくって
243.english: so he asked me to say hi for him.

244.speaker: SASAKO
244.english: It took him quite a while to ask out Miss Penko, didn't it?

245.speaker: PANDA
245.japanese: ２年くらい　来られないかもしれないね
245.english: He might not be able to come by for a couple years.

248.speaker: PENGUIN
248.japanese: へぇ～　ベアーズ　勝ったんだ
248.english: Wow, the Bears won. I see. Mr. Penguin. You're not going to Brown Bear's Café today?

249.speaker: PENGUIN
249.japanese: やっぱり　僕のカフェはしろくまカフェしかないよ
249.english: My only café is Polar Bear's Café after all.

250.speaker: PANDA
250.japanese: ということは　ペンギンさんフラれた…

251.speaker: SASAKO
251.japanese: パンダくん　こういう時は　そっとしておいてあげて
251.english: Panda. Please leave him be at times like these.

252.speaker: PENGUIN
252.japanese: いいんだよ　笹子さん

253.speaker: PENGUIN
253.japanese: いつ飲んでも　ここのカフェモカはおいしいから
253.english: The café mochas here are always so good that I can't stop myself.

254.speaker: PENGUIN
254.japanese: ねぇ　笹子さん　パンダくん

256.speaker: PENGUIN
256.japanese: 今すぐ２人で　僕を励ましてよ！
256.english: Could you two cheer me up right now?

257.speaker: PENGUIN
257.japanese: 僕の　いいところを　パ～ッて言ってあげて！
257.english: Tell me {\i1}all{\i0} the great things about me!

259.speaker: PENGUIN
259.japanese: そう　ジャストナウ！　今！

260.speaker: PENGUIN
260.japanese: ほら　早くして　もう　頼むよ～！
260.english: Come on now, let's hurry it up. Come on!

262.speaker: PANDA
262.japanese: やっぱり　ペンギンさんの　めんどくささがないと
262.english: Polar Bear's Café just isn't the same

263.speaker: PANDA
263.japanese: しろくまカフェじゃないね
263.english: without Mr. Penguin being a nuisance.

264.speaker: PANDA
264.japanese: ねっ　シロクマくん

266.speaker: PENGUIN
266.japanese: 褒められてる気分と　責められてる気分のハーフ＆ハーフだな～
266.english: I feel like I'm being praised and attacked at the same time.

267.speaker: POLAR BEAR
267.japanese: カフェモカ　おかわり？
267.english: Would you like another café mocha? Yeah, I think I would.

268.speaker: PENGUIN
268.japanese: じゃ　僕の　いいところについて　ジャンジャン言ってよ！
268.english: All right. Bring on the praises!

269.speaker: PANDA
269.japanese: もう　売り切れたよ

271.speaker: SASAKO
271.japanese: えっ…　そうですね…　品切れです
271.english: Huh? Well, let's see... I'm out of stock.

273.speaker: POLAR BEAR
273.japanese: ペンギンさんの　いいところは人気があるから
273.english: I think all of the good things about you were so popular,

274.speaker: POLAR BEAR
274.japanese: 買い占められちゃったかな
274.english: that they all got bought up.

275.speaker: PENGUIN
275.japanese: シロクマくん！　上手いこと言ってないで
275.english: Quit being witty and say something

276.japanese: 僕の　いいところ言ってよ～！

277.speaker: PANDA
277.japanese: ペンギンさん　ペンギンさん

279.speaker: PANDA
279.japanese: ノーベル賞がとれるような大発見あったら教えてよ
279.english: If you know of some discovery worthy of the Nobel Prize, you should let me know.

280.speaker: PENGUIN
280.english: I don't think I know of any.

281.speaker: PENGUIN
281.japanese: もしあったら　君に教えずにノーベル賞をいただいてるよ
281.english: Even if I did, I wouldn't tell you and I'd get the Nobel Prize myself.

282.speaker: PANDA
282.japanese: じゃ　ただの大発見でいいよ
282.english: Then how about a normal discovery?

284.japanese: 出入り時バタバタするっているとだいたい怒られないよね
284.english: saying you were in a hurry usually gets you out of trouble.

287.speaker: POLAR BEAR
287.japanese: 来週のしろくまカフェは

288.speaker: POLAR BEAR
288.english: will only have one moving part.

289.speaker: PENGUIN
289.english: Let's make sure it's moving in general.
